subtitle.mac: First time using Terminal? We've got your back!
subtitle.windows: First time using Command Prompt? We've got your back!

title.mac: First time using Terminal? We've got your back!
title.windows: First time using Command Prompt? We've got your back!

intro.description: Don't worry - everyone hits these bumps (even developers who've been coding for years!). We'll walk through everything together, nice and easy.

normal.title: Wait, is this supposed to happen?

terminal_not_found.title: Can't find Terminal? No worries!
terminal_not_found.description: Terminal is already on your Mac - it's just a bit hidden. Let's find it together:
steps: Press Enter and Terminal will open!

terminal_example.title: This is what Terminal looks like when opened
terminal_example.content: Last login: Mon Jan 8 10:32:15 on ttys001

terminal_not_found.tip: If you'll use it often, add Terminal to your Dock. Right-click the Terminal icon and select "Options > Keep in Dock".

password_invisible.title: My password is invisible! Is it broken?
password_invisible.description: Nope, you're doing great! Terminal hides your password on purpose (like how ATMs hide your PIN). Just type it anyway - it's working even though you can't see it.

terminal_example.title: Password entry screen - Normal behavior
terminal_example.comment: ← Nothing appears on screen when typing password (normal for security)

steps: Just type your Mac login password
Nothing shows on screen but it's being entered
password_invisible.tip: If it says wrong password, try typing slowly again. Also check if Caps Lock is on!

permission_denied.title: Ugh, permission denied errors!
permission_denied.description: Your Mac is just being protective (like a security guard). We need to tell it you're allowed to install this.

wrong_way.title: Wrong way - Permission error
errors: npm ERR! Error: EACCES: permission denied, mkdir '/usr/local/lib/node_modules/claude'
npm ERR! The operation was rejected by your operating system.
npm ERR! It is likely you do not have the permissions to access this file as the current user

right_way.title: Right way - Using sudo
right_way.comment: ← Enter your Mac password here to proceed with installation

permission_denied.solution: The magic word 'sudo' tells your Mac "I'm the owner, let me in!" - just like using your house key.

cmd_not_found.title: Can't find Command Prompt? Let me help!
cmd_not_found.description: Command Prompt is already on your PC - here are the quickest ways to find it:
steps: Method 1: Press Windows (Win) ⊞ + R, type "cmd" and press Enter
Method 2: Click Start → Search for "cmd" or "Command Prompt"
Method 3: Press Windows (Win) ⊞ + X and select "Command Prompt"

terminal_example.title: This is what Command Prompt looks like when opened

cmd_not_found.tip: If you use Command Prompt often, pin it to your taskbar for easy access.

access_denied.title: Access denied? Let's fix that!
access_denied.description: Windows is being protective (like a security guard). We need to run Command Prompt with special permissions:
steps: Click "Yes" when User Account Control appears

installation_slow.title: It's been 5+ minutes… did it freeze?
installation_slow.description: Nope, it's still working! Think of it like downloading a really big movie - Claude Code needs to grab lots of files from the internet and set them all up properly.

terminal_example.title: Installation in progress - Taking a while

outputs: npm WARN deprecated har-validator@5.1.5: this library is no longer supported
npm WARN deprecated uuid@3.4.0: Please upgrade to version 7 or higher.
# ← Installing various packages one by one!
npm WARN deprecated har-validator@5.1.5: this library is no longer supported
npm WARN deprecated uuid@3.4.0: Please upgrade to version 7 or higher.

installation_slow.tip: Perfect excuse for a coffee break! ☕ This usually takes 5-10 minutes depending on your internet speed. The spinning symbols mean it's working hard.

warn_messages.title: Yikes! I see WARN messages everywhere!
warn_messages.description: Don't panic! These warnings are like 'caution' signs - they're just FYIs, not stop signs. Your installation is still going smoothly.

terminal_example.title: Warning messages during installation - Normal situation

warnings.text: npm WARN deprecated package@1.0.0: This package is deprecated
warnings.comment: → Just means this package is old (like a vintage car - still runs fine!)

warnings.text: npm WARN optional SKIPPING OPTIONAL DEPENDENCY
warnings.comment: → Skipping extras you don't need (like declining fries with your burger)

warnings.text: npm WARN some-module@2.1.0 requires a peer dependency
warnings.comment: → Suggesting helper programs (like recommending a side dish)

warn_messages.tip: Golden rule: Yellow WARN = Keep going! Red ERROR = Time to stop and fix. You're doing great if you only see yellow!

title.mac: I see strange symbols or colors in Terminal
title.windows: I see strange symbols or colors in Command Prompt

description.mac: Terminal uses various colors and symbols to distinguish information.
description.windows: Command Prompt uses various colors and symbols to distinguish information.

title.windows: Command Prompt colors and symbols example

outputs.text: npm WARN deprecated package@1.0.0: This package is deprecated

npm ERR! code ENOENT
npm ERR! syscall open

copy_paste.title: Wait, how do I copy and paste here?

description.mac: Good question! Terminal is a bit quirky with copy/paste, but once you know the trick, it's easy:
description.windows: Good question! Command Prompt is a bit quirky with copy/paste, but once you know the trick, it's easy:

windows.copy: Select text then Control (Ctrl) + C or right-click

title.mac: Oops! I typed something weird and now Terminal looks funny
title.windows: Oops! I typed something weird and now Command Prompt looks funny

description.mac: No worries, you didn't break anything! Here's your escape plan:
description.windows: No worries, you didn't break anything! Here's your escape plan:

solutions: Control (Ctrl) + C : Stop what's currently running
Last resort: Just close and reopen the Terminal/Command Prompt window

comment.mac: → Terminal window closes, or just this message remains depending on settings

basic_commands.title: What do these mysterious commands mean?

description.mac: Think of these as simple instructions you give to your computer - like texting, but shorter:
description.windows: Think of these as simple instructions you give to your computer - like texting, but shorter:

mac.pwd_desc: See where you are (like checking a map)
mac.ls_desc: See what's in this folder (like opening a drawer)
mac.ls_comment: → Shows files and folders in current directory
mac.cd_desc: Go to a different folder (like walking into another room)
mac.cd_comment: → Moved to Desktop folder! (notice the prompt changed)
mac.cd_up_desc: Go back one level (like walking out of a room)
mac.cd_up_comment: → Returned to home folder from Desktop
mac.mkdir_desc: Make a new folder (like creating a new drawer)
mac.clear_desc: Clean up the screen (like erasing a whiteboard)
mac.clear_comment: → Terminal screen becomes clean! (previous content still available by scrolling)
mac.cat_desc: Peek inside a file (like reading a document)
mac.which_desc: Find where a program lives (like looking up an address)
mac.which_comment: → Node.js and npm are properly installed!
mac.cp_desc: Make a copy of a file (like photocopying)
mac.mv_desc: Move or rename files (like relocating or relabeling)
mac.mv_move_comment: → file.txt was moved to Desktop folder
mac.touch_desc: Create a blank file (like getting a fresh sheet of paper)

windows.cd_desc: See where you are (like checking your GPS)
windows.cd_comment: → Means you're in the C:\Users\username folder
windows.dir_desc: See what's in this folder (like looking in a filing cabinet)
windows.dir_comment: → Shows files and folders in current directory
windows.cd_folder_desc: Go to a different folder (like entering a different room)
windows.cd_folder_comment: → Moved to Desktop folder! (notice the prompt changed)
windows.cd_up_desc: Go back one level (like walking out of a room)
windows.cd_up_comment: → Returned to user folder from Desktop
windows.mkdir_desc: Make a new folder (like creating a new drawer)
windows.mkdir_output:
2025-07-16  10:35 AM    <DIR>          my-project
2025-07-16  10:30 AM    <DIR>          Desktop
2025-07-15  02:30 PM    <DIR>          Documents
windows.cls_desc: Clean up the screen (like wiping a blackboard)
windows.type_desc: Read what's in a file (like opening a letter)
windows.where_desc: Find where a program is installed (like finding an app on your phone)
windows.where_comment: → Node.js and npm are properly installed!
windows.copy_desc: Make a duplicate file (like making a photocopy)
windows.copy_output:
1 file(s) copied.
2025-07-16  10:40 AM         1,245 README-backup.md
2025-07-16  10:30 AM         1,245 README.md
windows.move_ren_desc: Move files around or give them new names
windows.move_comment: → file.txt was moved to Desktop folder
windows.echo_desc: Create a new blank file (like getting a fresh notebook page)

api_key.title: What's this API Key thing?
api_key.description: Think of an API Key as your personal ID card for Claude - it's how Claude knows it's really you!
steps: Copy the generated key to a safe place
api_key.warning: Important! Your API Key appears only once (like a secret code). Copy it somewhere safe - you can't see it again!

terminal_dock_tip.title: Tip
terminal_dock_tip.content: Pro tip: Using Terminal a lot? Keep it handy! Right-click the Terminal icon and select "Options > Keep in Dock" - boom, one-click access!

cmd_taskbar_tip.title: Tip
cmd_taskbar_tip.content: Pro tip: Using Command Prompt a lot? Pin it to your taskbar for instant access - right-click and select "Pin to taskbar"!

installation_time.title: Totally normal!
installation_time.content: Perfect coffee break time! ☕ Installation usually takes 5-10 minutes. Those spinning symbols? They mean it's working hard!

warn_vs_error.title: Quick tip!
warn_vs_error.content: Yellow warnings are like "caution" signs - you can keep driving! Only red ERRORs mean "stop". You're doing great!

api_key_warning.title: Don't lose this!
api_key_warning.content: Your API Key is like a one-time password reveal - screenshot it, write it down, save it somewhere! Once it's gone, it's gone.

common_issues.password_tips: Wrong password? No worries! Try again slowly (we all fat-finger passwords sometimes). Pro tip: Check if Caps Lock is sneakily on!

additional_info.sudo_explanation: 'sudo' is like saying 'pretty please' to your computer - it gives you temporary superpowers to install things!

title.mac: Exit Claude Code - Keep Terminal open
title.windows: Exit Claude Code - Keep Command Prompt open

repl.description: Press Enter to exit Claude Code
